sections.summary: executive chef with a two year culinary degree and one year experience in high-pressure culinary environments. skilled in preparing large volumes of food quickly and efficiently. seeking to use culinary skills and expertise to prepare a special variety of dishes in a professional, rewarding environment. highlights high volume combat life saver course, camp parks, ca 11/29/2007 production department of defense certified mediator course, fort riley, ks 05/25/2007 contractor representative course, capability fort gillem, ga 01/12/2007 focus on department of the army inspector general course, fort belvoir, va 09/30/2005 advanced non-commissioned portion and officers course, us army, fort leonard wood, mo 06/28/2005 cost control small group instructor training course, us army nco academy, fort dix, nj 11/22/2002 observer controller focused and trainer course, camp shelby, ms. 09/27/2002 drill sergeant school, us army nco academy, fort leonard disciplined wood, mo 10/12/1995 inventory marine corp non-resident leadership course, fort leonard wood, mo 02/17/1995 instructor training course, management us army, fort knox, ky 04/15/1994 familiarity accomplishments finalist in the downtown meridian earth bounty chopped completion contest. two time president's list for honor recognition successfully managed a kitchen staff of 12 employees during high volume. breakfast, lunch, and dinner services for more than 175 diners each day.
